p: The nature of the pectin domains in spruce bark ( Figure 4a) was deduced from the glycosidic linkage assignments that are characteristic for the different cell wall polysaccharides [ 53], as provided in Table 3. The results from the polysaccharide assignment based on the glycosidic linkages were then processed together with the DP obtained with SEC-MALLS in order to estimate the DP of each pectic domain ( Figure 4b). This last estimation was based on the hypotheses that all domains were covalently linked to each other and that the pectin distributions in the fractions were monodisperse.
